New Records: Matt Olson has played in 600 consecutive games, a streak dating back to May 2, 2021, making him one of the most durable players in recent MLB history.
Post-Match Reflections: The Braves suffered a 9-5 loss to the Toronto Blue Jays, falling 1.0 game behind the New York Mets for the final wild card spot.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Olson's streak is the longest among active players, with only a few others having similar records in the divisional era.
